title: Client stuck on loading
body: When I tried to login, the client is stuck on this screen (http://prntscr.com/gmamyi). It has been stuck like this for about 45 minutes. How would I go about fixing this?

replies.body: That is happening to me to!! What can I do?

> [{quoted}](name=Hi Im ShaDoWs,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=in1Hdq2N,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-11-03T14:58:16.576+0000)
>
> That is happening to me to!! What can I do?

Sorry for late response, but go into the client, and click the gear on login screen (top right) Go to general then initiate full repair. Worked like a charm for me.
Hey ! I am actually experiencing the same issue. Did anything work for you ? This is so frustrating xD
Seems like the client got stuck while trying to log you in. No worries, you should be able to close out and open the client back up and try again.
I restarted my computer after it initially happened and the client still didn't work. Tried again just now (7 hours later) same problem.

I was hoping this was just some kind of hang up with the authentication servers, but it sounds more like your network can't get a clear connection at this point. Take some time to look over your network settings using this [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues), but do pay close attention to how you can setup port forwarding and flush your DNS.

My brother can still log in fine, and we are both using Ethernet cables to connect, while on the same wifi, could a connection issue occur on only one computer? Or should I take a deep look at the connection guide you linked?

Oh most definitely. Even though both computers are using the same network, they could have 2 very different qualities. Go ahead and look through that guide, but do pay extra attention to the port forwarding and DNS settings as they tend to have the most success in my experience.

http://prntscr.com/gn92hc I'm not very familiar with this, but I assume I should not be having trouble with these results?
In attempting to forward ports, I got this error http://prntscr.com/gn94wu when trying to connect to my default gateway. I also flushed my DNS, but still, same problem. Should I try to uninstall/re-install?

Reinstalling most likely won't help with a connection issue like this. Let's get you a little more in-depth help from our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They can take a closer look at some of your network logs to see what's going wrong.
Alright thank you, I will try that, and just to make sure, my issue is an issue with Pvp.net Client correct?
It kinda sounds like this might be some kind of ISP issue, and I'm not currently seeing any issues with the servers, but that doesn't mean something might be wrong with your client itself though.
Alright, thank you very much man I have submitted a support ticket and I really appreciate the helpful and timely responses, thanks
